tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE nuclear_power_plants (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name VARCHAR(255),
    capacity DOUBLE,
    safety_record TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE safety_records (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_id INT,
    inspection_date DATE,
    violation_type VARCHAR(50),
    violation_details TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES nuclear_power_plants(location_id)
);

CREATE TABLE nuclear_power_plant_locations (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name VARCHAR(255),
    address VARCHAR(255),
    capacity_mw INT
)

CREATE TABLE nuclear_power_plant_capacities (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT,
    capacity_mw INT,
    year_installed INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (plant_id) REFERENCES nuclear_power_plant_locations(id)
)

CREATE TABLE nuclear_power_plant_safety_records (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT,
    inspection_date DATE,
    safety_rating VARCHAR(100),
    FOREIGN KEY (plant_id) REFERENCES nuclear_power_plant_locations(id)
)

CREATE TABLE power_plants (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    capacity DECIMAL,
    safety_record VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    role VARCHAR(50),
    department VARCHAR(50),
    salary DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE incidents (
    incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    description TEXT,
    date_occurred DATE,
    location VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    maintenance_date DATE,
    description TEXT,
    employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE power_plant_employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT REFERENCES nuclear_power_plants(plant_id),
    employee_name VARCHAR(50),
    job_title VARCHAR(50),
    salary DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE plant_sensors (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT REFERENCES nuclear_power_plants(plant_id),
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    reading DECIMAL,
    reading_time TIMESTAMP
);
